citation.article-title: Thermoanaerobacter tengcongensis sp. nov., a novel anaerobic, saccharolytic, thermophilic bacterium isolated from a hot spring in Tengcong, China.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thermoanaerobacter tengcongensis sp. nov
Thermoanaerobacter tengcongensis (teng.con.gen'sis. N.L. masc. adj. tengcongensis pertaining to Tengcong, China)
Cells are Gram-negative rods, 0.5-0.6 μm in diameter and 1-10 μm in length, occurring singly, in pairs or in chains.

Growth occurs at temperatures between 50 and 80 °C, with an optimum of around 75 °C; at pH values between 5±5 and 9±0, with an optimum of 7.0-7.5; and at salinities between 0 and 2.5% NaCl, with an optimum of around 0.2% NaCl.
Optimal doubling time is about 65 min.
Heterotrophic growth requires yeast extract, which cannot be replaced by Tryptone or Casamino acids.

maltose, cellobiose, mannose, fructose, lactose, mannitol and starch, but not arabinose, sucrose, ribose, xylose, cellulose, alginate, xylan, acetate, pyruvate, butyrate, lactate, citrate, malate or glycerol.
The major fermentation end product on glucose is acetate.
Chloromycetin, polymyxin B, streptomycin sulfate and tetracycline.
The genomic DNA has a G­+C content of 33 mol%.
The isolate was obtained from a hot spring in Tengcong, China.
The type strain is MB4T (=Chinese Collection of MicroorganismsAS 1.2430T=JCM 11007T).
